column4: so sudo iptables -L shows my current firewall rules, how do I remove all firewall rules?
Oh duh, that was an RTFM'er there.
looks like it has another name. All 'scale' effects are turned on
No, it's scale, you need to set the edge trigger
Go to bindings inside the scale plugin, and then change initiate window picker to topLeft, etc
sorry, you are right. Bindings are not set
have you fixed the problen with iptables? :)

Yea, it was something dumb ;) I flushed them and the default rule was to block all, but then when I restarted firestarter restored the old rules... Basically I forgot that I had installed firestarter a long time ago; that's where all those rules came from
okay. Actually the most clear way to handle firewall rules which I found is using iptables-restore/save
don't login as root, use sudo
how can I use sudo if it is web interfaces. I said: SWAT question
Yea, I thought you had to logout and backin
